description:
The NeonSlider component is the equivalent of an <input type="range" />. In addition to this, there is support for automatic formatting the min, max and selected value plus options for percentage formatting and providing custom templates, e.g. currency formatting.

NeonNumber also supports all relevant properties found on an HTML <input>.

props.name: percentage
props.description: Automatically applies % formatting, e.g. if the value = 0.15 it will be displayed as 15%.

props.name: step
props.description:
The size of steps between values the user can select. The default value is 1 except when percentage = true the
default is 0.01 (1%).

props.name: decimals
props.description: The rounding precision for display purposes.

props.name: valueTemplate
props.description:
A template string used for formatting the display value. Use the placeholder {value} to reference the value in the
template string. e.g. value = 90, ${value} => $90.

props.name: disableFormatting
props.description: Disable formatting, e.g. in the case of a year value -> display as 2020, not 2,020.

props.name: max
props.description: The maximum range value. The default value is 100 except when percentage = true the default is 1 (100%).

props.name: lowerBound
props.description: The lower bound within the range of values.

props.name: upperBound
props.description: The upper bound within the range of values.

events.name: update:modelValue
events.description: Event triggered when the value changes.
